solution_line_template: The shark went from {keanu_speed} miles per hour to a speed of {shark_speed_multiplier}*{keanu_speed}={shark_new_speed} miles per hour.
The shark increased its speed by {shark_new_speed}-{keanu_speed}=<<{shark_new_speed}-{keanu_speed}={shark_speed_increase}>>{shark_speed_increase} miles per hour.
Half of the shark's increase in speed is {shark_speed_increase}/{half_divisor}=<<{shark_speed_increase}/{half_divisor}={pilot_fish_speed_increase}>>{pilot_fish_speed_increase} miles per hour.
Thus the pilot fish had increased its speed to {keanu_speed}+{pilot_fish_speed_increase}=<<{keanu_speed}+{pilot_fish_speed_increase}={pilot_fish_final_speed}>>{pilot_fish_final_speed} miles per hour.
